questions.description: A tissue is a group of cells which are

options.description: similar in origin, but dissimilar in form and function
dissimilar in origin, form and function
dissimilar in origin, but similar in form and function
similar in origin, form and function

options.description: These are parenchyma cells with thickened lignified walls
These are elongated and flexible with tapered ends

Meristematic tissue responsible for increase in girth of tree trunk is

bordered pits on their lateral walls

simple perforation on their end walls

In stems, the protoxylem lies towards the ______ and the metaxylem lies towards the ______ of the organ.

questions.description: A student was given a tissue to observe under the microscope. He observes the tissue and concludes that the tissue is type of simple plant tissue and provides mechanical support to young stem and petiole of leaf ldentify the tissue?
Apical and intercalary meristems are primary meristems because

options.description: they occur in the mature region of roots and shoots of many plants
they made up of different kinds of tissues
they appear early in life of a plant and contribute to the formation of the primary plant body

questions.description: The length of different internodes in a culm of sugarcane is variable because of

options.description: size of leaf lamina at the node below each internode

questions.description: Identify A,B and C in the given figure of shoot apical meristem

options.description: A- Leaf primordium, B- Shoot apical meristem, C- Axillary bud
A- Leaf primordium, B- Shoot apical meristem, C-Apical bud
A - Root hair primordium, B- Root apical meristem, C- Axillary bud
A - Root hair primordium, B - Root apical meristem, C- Terminal bud

questions.description: All the following statements regarding sieve tube elements are correct except that

options.description: their end walls have perforated sieve plates which become impregnated with lignin at maturity.
they possess peripheral cytoplasm as well as a large vacuole.
distinct proteinaceous inclusions, the P-proteins are seen evenly distributed throughout the lumen.
long, slender, tube-like structures arranged in longitudinal series.

questions.description: Which one of the following is well developed and present in hydrophytes?
Which of the following group of cells make up the Cojuctive tissue?

options.description: Parenchymatous cells lying between xylem and phloem.
Cells present between tight and gap junctions
Cells of conjoint type of vascular bundles
Meristematic cells present between two nodes

options.description: most of angiosperms and few gymnosperms
all angiosperms, all gymnosperms and some pteriodophyta

questions.description: Cork cambium and vascular cambium are

options.description: parts of secondary xylem and phloem

questions.description: Companion cells are closely associated with
Ground tissue includes

options.description: all tissues except epidermis and vascular bundles

questions.description: In land plants, the guard cells differ from other epidermal cells in having.

Some vascular bundles are described as open because these

options.description: are surrounded by pericycle but not endodermis
are capable of producing secondary xylem and  phloem
possess conjunctive tissue between xylem and phloem

questions.description: Which of the following statements is not correct for stomatal apparatus?

options.description: Inner walls of guard cells are thick and in elastic
Guard cells invariably possess chloroplasts and mitochondria.
Guard cells does not possess subsidiary cells
Stomata are involved in gaseous exchange.

questions.description: Which of the following statement(s) is/are Correct about epidermal tissue system?

options.description: It forms the outer-most covering of the whole plant body and comprises epidermal cells, stomata and the epidermal appendages - the trichomes and hairs
Epidermal cells are parenchymatous with a small amount of cytoplasm lining the cell wall and a large vacuole.
Epidermis is often covered with a waxy thick layer called the cuticle which prevents the loss of water.

questions.description: The given diagram show stomatal apparatus in monocots. Which one is correct option for. A, B and C?

options.description: A - Epidermal cells; B - Subsidiary cells; C -chloroplast
A- Guard cells; B - Subsidiary cells; C- Stomatal pore
A - Guard cells; B - Epidermal cells; C- Guard cells
A - Epidermal cells; B - Subsidiary cells; C -Guard cells

options.description: lt is large-sized, thin-walled colourless, vacuolate cells on the adaxial surface.

exodermis, endarch, tetrarch closed vascular bundles.
